did.head: Descriptive Summary

did.unittitle: Cycles of Struggle: Genealogies of the Local Left records 2005
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: The Cycles of Struggle: Genealogies of the Local Left conference was held at Duke University on November 11-12, 2005 with the purpose to "revisit the history of political organizing at Duke, in Durham, and in North Carolina… bringing to light the memory of this rich local history [to] inspire those already involved today in various forms of activism and those who might become involved in the future." Collection includes postcards, pamphlets, flyers, publications, comic strips, statement of purpose, and conference schedule.
Collection includes postcards, pamphlets, flyers, publications, comic strips, statement of purpose, and conference schedule.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Cycles of Struggle: Genealogies of the Local Left Records, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Cycles of Struggle: Genealogies of the Local Left records were received by the University Archives as a transfer in 2005.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accession UA2005-0085 is described in this finding aid.
Descriptive sources and standards used to create this inventory: DACS, EAD, NCEAD guidelines, and our local Style Guide.
This finding aid is NCEAD compliant.

bioghist.p: The Cycles of Struggle: Genealogies of the Local Left conference was held at Duke University on November 11-12, 2005 with the purpose to "revisit the history of political organizing at Duke, in Durham, and in North Carolina… bringing to light the memory of this rich local history [to] inspire those already involved today in various forms of activism and those who might become involved in the future." Speakers at the conference include Glenda Gilmore, Robert Korstad, Christina Greene, Vivian McCoy, Devin Fergus, Rev. John Mendez, Sally Bermanzohn, Bob Hall, Karen Brodkin, and Mab Segrest.

scopecontent.p: Collection includes postcards, pamphlets, flyers, publications, comic strips, statement of purpose, and conference schedule for the Cycles of Struggle: Genealogies of the Local Left conference held at Duke University, Nov. 11-12, 2005.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.
